com.ibm.mobile.services.location.geo

Class IBMGeoUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.mobile.services.location.geo.IBMGeoUtils

  • public class IBMGeoUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides access to utility functions for Geo calculations. The IBMGeoUtils class is a provisional API. APIs that are marked provisional are evolving and might change or be removed in future releases.

    • Method Detail

      • getDistanceBetweenCoordinates

        public static double getDistanceBetweenCoordinates(IBMPosition coordinate1,
                                   IBMPosition coordinate2)
        Calculates the distance between two positions.

        The distance between two positions is calculated. The result is returned in meters, using a spherical model of the Earth.

        Parameters:
        coordinate1 - The first coordinate.
        coordinate2 - The second coordinate.
        Returns:
        The distance in meters between the two positions.

      • getDistanceToCircle

        public static double getDistanceToCircle(IBMPosition coordinate,
                         IBMPosition center,
                         double radius)
        Calculates the distance of the coordinate from the circle. Equivalent to calling getDistanceToCircle(IBMPosition, IBMPosition, double, double)} with a 0 as the bufferZoneWidth parameter.
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        center -
        radius -
        Returns:
        the distance in meters to the circle. The distance is positive for positions outside the circle and negative for positions inside the circle.

      • getDistanceToCircle

        public static double getDistanceToCircle(IBMPosition coordinate,
                         IBMPosition center,
                         double radius,
                         double bufferZoneWidth)
        Calculates the distance of the coordinate from the circle, taking into account the buffer zone.
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        center -
        radius -
        bufferZoneWidth - The buffer zone width is measured in meters. It enlarges the radius of the circle by this amount. Negative values make the circle smaller.
        Returns:
        The distance, in meters, to the circle, taking into account the buffer zone. The distance is positive for positions outside the circle, and negative for positions within the circle. If the bufferZoneWidth is negative and has an absolute value greater than the radius, this method will return the constant Double.NaN.

      • isInsideCircle

        public static boolean isInsideCircle(IBMPosition coordinate,
                     IBMPosition center,
                     double radius)
        Returns a boolean value based on whether a coordinate lies within a circle. Equivalent to calling isInsideCircle(IBMPosition, IBMPosition, double, double, IBMConfidenceLevel) with a bufferZoneWidth of 0 and a confidenceLevel of IBMConfidenceLevel.LOW}.
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        center -
        radius -
        Returns:
        The value true is returned if the coordinate is within the circle.

      • isInsideCircle

        public static boolean isInsideCircle(IBMPosition coordinate,
                     IBMPosition center,
                     double radius,
                     double bufferZoneWidth,
                     IBMConfidenceLevel confidenceLevel)
        Returns a boolean value based on whether a coordinate lies within a circle, taking into account the buffer zone and confidence level.
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        center -
        radius -
        bufferZoneWidth - The buffer zone width is measured in meters. It enlarges the radius of the circle by this amount. Negative values make the circle smaller.
        confidenceLevel - The level of confidence indicates how accuracy is taken into account.
        Returns:
        The value true is returned if the coordinate lies inside the circle, at the given level of confidence. The dimensions of the circle used in this check incorporate any changes specified for the bufferZoneWidth parameter.

      • isOutsideCircle

        public static boolean isOutsideCircle(IBMPosition coordinate,
                      IBMPosition center,
                      double radius)
        Returns a boolean value based on whether a coordinate lies outside a circle. Equivalent to calling #isOutsideCircle(IBMPosition, IBMCoordiante, double, double, IBMConfidenceLevel) with a bufferZoneWidth of 0 and a confidenceLevel of IBMConfidenceLevel.LOW}.
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        center -
        radius -
        Returns:
        true if the coordinate is outside the circle.

      • isOutsideCircle

        public static boolean isOutsideCircle(IBMPosition coordinate,
                      IBMPosition center,
                      double radius,
                      double bufferZoneWidth,
                      IBMConfidenceLevel confidenceLevel)
        Returns a boolean value based on whether a coordinate lies outside a circle, taking into account the buffer zone and confidence level.
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        center -
        radius -
        bufferZoneWidth - The buffer zone width is measured in meters. It enlarges the radius of the circle by this amount. Negative values make the circle smaller.
        confidenceLevel - The level of confidence indicates how accuracy is taken into account.
        Returns:
        The value true is returned if the coordinate lies outside the circle, at the given level of confidence. The dimensions of the circle used in this check incorporate any changes specified for the bufferZoneWidth parameter.

      • getDistanceToPolygon

        public static double getDistanceToPolygon(IBMPosition coordinate,
                          IBMPolygon polygon)
        Calculates the distance of a coordinate from a polygon. Equivalent to calling getDistanceToPolygon(IBMPosition, IBMPolygon, double) with a 0 as the bufferZoneWidth parameter.
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        polygon -
        Returns:
        The distance, in meters, to the polygon. The distance is positive for positions outside the polygon, and negative for positions within the polygon.

      • getDistanceToPolygon

        public static double getDistanceToPolygon(IBMPosition coordinate,
                          IBMPolygon polygon,
                          double bufferZoneWidth)
        Calculates the distance of a coordinate from the outer ring a polygon, taking into account the buffer zone.
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        polygon -
        bufferZoneWidth - The buffer zone width is measured in meters. It increases the size of the polygon in all directions by this amount. Negative values decrease the polygon's size.
        Returns:
        The distance, in meters, to the polygon, taking into account the buffer zone. The distance is positive for positions outside the polygon, and negative for positions within the polygon.

      • isInsidePolygon

        public static boolean isInsidePolygon(IBMPosition coordinate,
                      IBMPolygon polygon)
        Returns a boolean value based on whether a coordinate lies within the outer ring of a polygon. Equivalent to calling isInsidePolygon(IBMPosition, IBMPolygon, double, IBMConfidenceLevel) with a bufferZoneWidth of 0 and a confidenceLevel of IBMConfidenceLevel.LOW}.
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        polygon -
        Returns:
        The value true is returned if the coordinate is within the polygon.

      • isInsidePolygon

        public static boolean isInsidePolygon(IBMPosition coordinate,
                      IBMPolygon polygon,
                      double bufferZoneWidth,
                      IBMConfidenceLevel confidenceLevel)
        Returns a boolean value based on whether a coordinate lies within the outer ring of a polygon, taking into account the buffer zone and confidence level.
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        polygon -
        bufferZoneWidth - The buffer zone width is measured in meters. It increases the size of the polygon in all directions by this amount. Negative values decrease the polygon's size.
        confidenceLevel - The level of confidence indicates how accuracy is taken into account.
        Returns:
        The value true is returned if the coordinate lies inside the polygon, at the given level of confidence. The dimensions of the polygon used in this check incorporate any changes specified for the bufferZoneWidth parameter.

      • isOutsidePolygon

        public static boolean isOutsidePolygon(IBMPosition coordinate,
                       IBMPolygon polygon,
                       double bufferZoneWidth,
                       IBMConfidenceLevel confidenceLevel)
        Returns a boolean value based on whether a coordinate lies outside the outer ring of a polygon, taking into account the buffer zone and confidence level.
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        polygon -
        bufferZoneWidth - The buffer zone width is measured in meters. It increases the size of the polygon in all directions by this amount. Negative values decrease the polygon's size.
        confidenceLevel - The level of confidence indicates how accuracy is taken into account.
        Returns:
        The value true is returned if the coordinate lies outside the polygon, at the given level of confidence. The dimensions of the polygon used in this check incorporate any changes specified for the bufferZoneWidth parameter.

      • isOutsidePolygon

        public static boolean isOutsidePolygon(IBMPosition coordinate,

      • isInsideArea

        public static boolean isInsideArea(IBMPosition coordinate,
                   IBMArea area,
                   double bufferZoneWidth,
                   IBMConfidenceLevel confidenceLevel)
        Checks if the location is within the area taking into account the buffer zone and confidence level.
        Parameters:
        coordinate -
        area -
        bufferZoneWidth - The buffer zone width is measured in meters. It increases the size of the area in all directions by this amount. Negative values decrease the area's size.
        confidenceLevel - The level of confidence indicates how accuracy is taken into account.
        Returns:
        The value true is returned if the coordinate lies inside the area, at the given level of confidence. The dimensions of the area used in this check incorporate any changes specified for the bufferZoneWidth parameter.

      • isInsideArea

        public static boolean isInsideArea(IBMPosition coordinate,
                   IBMArea area)

        Parameters:

        area -
        Returns:
